description_html: Keep it objective: no first or second person.
story_html:
Make it personal (first and second person ok), preferably with a beginning, middle, and end.

To keep up to date, follow this site on social media or subscribe to the Artsy Visions Monthly Newsletter!
affiliate_ad_html:
Get the Book/DVD!

There is a review of the series-title on ArtsyVisions.com. We highly recommend watching the book/series/movie!

Clicking on the affiliate link in the button below and making a purchase helps to support this site, at no additional cost to you.

Buy It Now!
Buy It Now!
Buy It Now!

image_list.title: Amy Klobuchar
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Amy Klobuchar's spiritual portrait shows she is ______________.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Amy Klobuchar's dominant personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_dom_very_slight_preference: It's important to note this preference/tendency is very slight, and X can be quite _____ in some situations/when the situation calls for it.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Amy Klobuchar's auxiliary personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to new experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux_very_slight_preference: It's important to note this preference is very slight, and X can be quite _____ in some situations/when the situation calls for it.
image_list.disclosure_html: This story contains some affiliate marketing links. Clicking on one of these and making a purchase helps support SeeOurMinds.com.
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.

image_list.title: Bernie Sanders
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Bernie Sanders' spiritual portrait shows he is ______________.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Bernie Sanders' dominant personality trait, iNtuition: idealism and hope for the future; openness to new ideas; very slight/moderate/strong preference for ideas over facts.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Bernie Sanders' auxiliary personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the/tendency to be more logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.disclosure_html: This story contains some affiliate marketing links. Clicking on one of these and making a purchase helps support SeeOurMinds.com.
